section_title: Osteochondral Autograft Transplantation - Talus (Evidence: pg no: 21, L968)
names: Osteochondral autograft transplantation (Evidence: pg no: 21, L969)
Osteochondral autograft transplant (Evidence: pg no: 21, L969)
description: Osteochondral autograft transplantation or microfracture to treat cartilaginous defects of the talus (Evidence: pg no: 21, L969-L973)
scope: Treatment of talar cartilage defects (Evidence: pg no: 21, L968-L973)

documentation: EITHER large (area > 1.0 cm2) or cystic (volume > 3.0 cm3) osteochondral lesions of talus OR revision surgery after failed marrow stimulation for osteochondral lesions of talus (Evidence: pg no: 21, L972-L973)

codes.description: Open osteochondral autograft, talus (includes obtaining graft[s]) (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1059)

Arthroscopically aided repair of large osteochondritis dissecans lesion, talar dome fracture, or tibial plafond fracture, with or without internal fixation (includes arthroscopy) (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1064-L1065)
